entry.title: Re: Dunning per Mail/Printing only if there is no Mail-Ad...
entry.content:
Hello @FabianSCC

The colums you are using seem to be part of the issue. Can you modify your table this way?

Step 1 (Email): Condition = Email address is not initial (this is the condition and not the default email column). Channel = Email. Exclusive = X.

Step 2 (PRINT): No condition. Channel = PRINT. Exclusive remains blank

Step

Output Type

Condition

Channel

Exclusive Indicator

Purpose

1

DUNN_NOTICE

Default E-Mail Address ≠ initial

EMAIL

x

If a BP has email, send only by email.

2

DUNN_NOTICE

(no condition)

PRINT

-

If no email exists, fallback to print.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Custom Money field is not working as expected
entry.content: Krishna, there are so many things that could be the issue here, more context is needed. I would confirm the currency conversion rate because if that is set to 1, the rates would be the same. Second, I would expect you have a custom formula in custom field, you need to ensure that all the fields there are properly calculating and that there is not a problem with a field within the formula. I might suggest you start by redefining the formula by deconstructing it into its pieces and recalculating the bonus to pinpoint where it may be going wrong. Also, it would be helpful to show screenshots of the custom field from the column designer and then show what the form looks like when you see it in functional vs. local. Maybe I can help troubleshoot if you provide more information.

entry.title: SAP Connect – Finance Connect, Las Vegas, Nevada
entry.content:
SAP Connect – Finance Connect, Las Vegas, Nevada

In-person event | October 6–8, 2025

Join us at the first SAP Connect, Finance Connect in Las Vegas, Nevada from October 6-8 2025!

Find out everything you need to know about the event here.

Explore the session catalog for a complete overview of all presentations, customer success stories, learnings, deep dives, latest innovations and more…

 

Agenda Highlights:

Keynote:

Finance as the conductor of the connected enterprise | FINKEY0005

Organizational success requires integration, not isolation. Collaborative finance teams benefit from simplified processes, increased productivity and enterprise-wide risk visibility. SAP Business Suite, with extensive applications, AI, and data, makes the connection. See how SAP solutions help finance connect across the enterprise to drive impact.

Presenters:

Alex Zimmermann, Director, Working Capital, Pfizer

David Imbert, Head of Finance Product Marketing, SAP

Tamzin Booth, Editorial Director, THE ECONOMIST GROUP LIMITED

Lawrence Martin, Chief Product Officer and Head of Cloud Engineering, SAP

Mary Kumar, Senior Vice President, Align Technology

Stephanie Miller, Global Vice President, SAP AMERICA, INC.

Lyle Honig Mojica, CFO, AIDS Healthcare Foundation

Dominik Asam, SAP CFO, SAP

Roadmap:

Transforming finance-led ERP and beyond: Laser-focused innovations unveiled | FIN2161

Discover the road map for finance-led ERP software from SAP and plans to deliver increasingly powerful solutions for the CFO organization through integrated capabilities in finance, sales, and procurement in the cloud. See how the combined strengths of applications, data, and AI from SAP can enable your business to transform in an uncertain world.

Presenters:

Sabrina Kunze, SVP, Head of Product Cloud ERP Finance - Service Centric, SAP SE

Johannes Beigel, Head of Public Cloud ERP Product Management, Finance, SAP SE

We look forward to seeing you in Las Vegas!

Should you not be able to join us in Las Vegas

Register now for SAP Connect Virtual

Join our virtual event on October 9, 2025. Registration includes access to on-demand content that you can explore anytime.

Register now

entry.title: Passing a LIST between Automations
entry.content:
Good day,

I've been trying to pass data out (output) of an Automation, into another one, and I'm not able to.  My Output Parameter was always blank.  I had to merge my logic into a single Automation to achieve my solution.

Sample Process:

Parameters of getData Automation:

I found some info that the best way to read from a local Excel file is to use the Excel Cloud Link activity, which is recommended to use a "any" type variable.  This type of variable does not seem to support LISTS either.  I then learned that the TRY statement creates an isolated local "visibility" layer, so I created my "global" variable outside this TRY later.  I tried different ways to pass the Excel data to my global variable (both work) but I cannot pass the data to my Automation Output Parameter.

Can someone confirm that LISTS are not supported as Parameters of Automations?

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: PO header and item text do not appear in printed form...
entry.content:
Please check in the following areas

Path: SPRO → Materials Management → Purchasing → Messages → Texts for Messages → Define Texts for Purchase Orders. Each text type (header, item) must be assigned to the output type and language. Often, only EN/FR/DE are maintained; IT may be missing. Check if the text ID (e.g. F01, F02) is linked to your PO form for Italian.

The PO print program (usually SAPFM06P with Smartform MEDRUCK or custom Z-form) controls which languages are supported. If Italian is not included in the form’s language key or translation objects, the text will be skipped. Check in SE71/SE78 (Smartforms) or SFP (Adobe) whether Italian translations exist for the text elements.

Go to SE75 and verify that the text object used for PO header/item texts has Italian maintained. If not, the system can’t retrieve the text in IT even if it exists in the PO.

Even if vendor and PO are in Italian, the output message language (NAST table, field SPRAS) is decisive. Check in ME9F or NAST whether the message is really being generated in IT. Sometimes the system defaults to logon language or company code language if Italian is not fully supported.

Best regards,
Soufiane

SAP Field Service Management #SAP AM #SAP FSM

entry.title: Purchase order Percentage Price Condition on Purchase order Item
entry.content:
Hello there lovely SAP Community, 

 

id like to create Purchase orders with Custom Price Condition that is %-Based using the API: 

SAP_COM_0238
 
According to the WSDL the Structure is: 
 
V1:
<PriceCondition>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionType>?</ConditionType>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionAmount currencyCode="?">?</ConditionAmount>
</PriceCondition>
V2:
<PricingCondition>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionType>?</ConditionType>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionTypeName>?</ConditionTypeName>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionRateValue>?</ConditionRateValue>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionCurrency>?</ConditionCurrency>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="?">?</ConditionQuantity>
</PricingCondition>
 
The Price Conditons should look like this: 
 

When i Create the PO with this Payload: (Version2) 

<ItemPrice>
<Amount currencyCode="DKK">100</Amount>
<BaseQuantity unitCode="PCE">1</BaseQuantity>
<!--Zero or more repetitions:-->
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZPB0</ConditionType>
<ConditionRateValue>100</ConditionRateValue>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionCurrency>EUR</ConditionCurrency>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="PCE">1</ConditionQuantity>
</PricingCondition>
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZRL1</ConditionType>
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="%">10</ConditionQuantity>
<!--Optional:-->

</PricingCondition>
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZRZ1</ConditionType>
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="%">10</ConditionQuantity>
<!--Optional:-->
</PricingCondition>
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZRZ2</ConditionType>
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="%">10</ConditionQuantity>
<!--Optional:-->
<!-- <ConditionQuantity unitCode="P1">100</ConditionQuantity> -->
</PricingCondition>
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZRZ3</ConditionType>
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="%">10</ConditionQuantity>
<!--Optional:-->
</PricingCondition>
</ItemPrice>

 

The Result looks like this: 

 

 

 

Note that i dont have any %-value. 

How can i set the Price Condition to 10 % ? 

kind regards, 

Philipp

entry.title: Re: SCE For material Discontinue
entry.content:
When you set a material to “Discontinued,” it often means no valid standard cost estimate or valuation price is maintained for the future period. The system still tries to valuate the material during SCE, but finds no price.
In the Accounting 1 view of the material master, fields like Standard Price (S) or Moving Average Price (V) may be blank or outdated. If no valid entry exists in the valuation area for the relevant period, the system cannot determine a price.
The error “No price could be determined” (CK465) means that none of the strategies in the valuation variant (e.g. standard cost estimate, planned price 1/2/3, moving average) succeeded in finding a value
You mentioned you will “arrange it in November 2025.” If you are running SCE before that date, the system has no valid cost estimate for the current period, so it errors out.

Perform the below steps to fix it

  • Ensure a valid Standard Price or Moving Average Price is maintained for the material in the relevant plant/company code. If the material is discontinued but still needed for processing, you can enter a Planned Price (Planned Price 1/2/3) for costing purposes.
  • Run a cost estimate (CK11 or CK40N) for the material and mark/release it so that a valid standard cost exists.
  • Make sure the valuation strategy (OKKN) includes a fallback (e.g. Planned Price 1) if no standard cost is found.

entry.title: Why asset doest not have material code in SAP ERP?
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Why does SAP's procurement process require the asset code to be created and linked at the Purchase Requisition (PR) stage, instead of allowing asset creation after the Goods Receipt (GR)? Wouldn't it be more logical to create the asset code only after confirming receipt and valuation of the asset, rather than at the PR entry stage? Instead why don't we create the asset as an material code and link in the PR?

Regards,

Nithin Pranesh

entry.title: Re: Manual Accrual getting reversed at the time of Delta...
entry.content:
Hi @priya_sshekhar, 

If the business agrees, you can post your manual Delta Accrual on the same day as the Final Settlement date or the last day of the contract.
In that case, you may use the posting date and document date as usual, and the system will only reverse the remaining accrual balance at the time of the Final Settlement - ensuring proper alignment of postings.

However, if your Partial or Final Settlement needs to account for source documents from a legacy system (i.e., if your open accrual balance includes legacy volumes), then you will need to:

  • Migrate those legacy source documents as pro forma entries,

  • Include them in your business volume,

  • And allow CCM to calculate the settlement amount accordingly.

In this case, you won’t need to post a manual Delta Accrual, but rather you’ll need to execute an automatic Delta Accrual based on the combination of:

  • Migrated legacy documents, and

  • Ongoing business volume captured in S/4HANA.

Regards, 
Gauthier Victor

entry.title: Re: How to rewrite this ABAP SQL join via the CDS associations and SQL Path Expression?
entry.content:
Instead of defining the SQL Path Expression in the FROM part, just have it in the list of selected columns:

SELECT DISTINCT PrelimBillingDocument,
                i_prelimbillingdocumentitem~\_salesdocument\_zzpurchaseorderitemacctassign[ MANY TO EXACT ONE ]-costcenter
  FROM I_PrelimBillingDocumentItem
  WHERE PrelimBillingDocument = 'PBD0000061'
    AND i_prelimbillingdocumentitem~\_salesdocument\_zzpurchaseorderitemacctassign[ MANY TO EXACT ONE ]-costcenter <> ' '
  INTO TABLE @DATA(lt_billing_doc_to_cost_center).

Please let me know what all configuration required for initial setup, data input.

Any points on this will be helpful.

entry.title: How to use Version Management with Github Repository
entry.content:
The Version Management application allows you to manage versions of BI resources that exist in the BI Platform repository. 
We have an Option to use the Version Management Application to Use Subversion or Git/ GitHub as a repository.
In this Blog, we will be checking on how to use the Version Management with Github as an repository

Downloading and Installing the GIT Application

  • Download the GIT application from : https://git-scm.com/ 
  • Download and install the GIT application on the BO Server. We will need this to configure later.

Configuration of Github 

  • Create an Account on Github - > https://github.com/ 
  • Create a Public repository on the Github which we want to use for Version Management.

Token Generation in Github and Maintaining the default branch

  1. Navigate to the Profile on the https://github.com/settings/profile
  2. Scroll Down to <> Developer Setting.
  3. Next Select the Personal Access Tokens > Tokens ( classic)
  4. Generate new token ( classic)

     

  5. Under Scopes Select Repo:

To check the default Branch. Navigate to Settings and then Repository : https://github.com/settings/repositories 

Master is been set as default

 

Configuring Version Management in CMC to use Github

  1. In CMC Home page, select Applications.
  2. Select Version Management.
  3. Choose Git from the Version Management Systems list.
  4. Click the checkbox Use as Default VMS.
  5. Under Protocol use HTTP(s). (HTTP is used if you want to completely use local GIT)
  6. Below are the parameters that needs to be maintained. 


    Parameters  Details
    User nameEnter the username of the Github account that was used to create repository
    GitHub personal access tokens (classic)Enter the token generated above from Github
    GitHub Remote Repository URLEnter the link to the Repository that was created on Github. <https://github.com/<username>/<Repository Name>
    Workspace DirectoryEnter the Path where you want to save your workspace.
    Repository NameEnter a name for your Github repository. Should be the same that is been created in Github. <Repository Name>
    GIT Install PathEnter the install directory of Git. <install_dir>\Git\bin
    Default Branch NameEnter the Default Branch name that is been maintained in your profile on github. 

  7. Once all the Details are maintained, Click on SAVE
  8. Restart the APS hosting the Version Management Services. 
  9. Navigate to the CMC > and access the Version Management Application

entry.title: SAP MDG: Based on Grouping, Tax Number is Mandatory
entry.content:
Hi SCN Folks, 

Hope you guys are doing great 🙂

Note: This blog does not include execution screenshots.

This post outlines a custom development approach in SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) to make the Tax Number field mandatory for specific Groupings. The logic is implemented using the enhancement framework via BADI: USMD_RULE_SERVICE, specifically through the method CHECK_ENTITY.

Prerequisite: A working knowledge of BADI USMD_RULE_SERVICE and ABAP development is required to follow this implementation.

Development Details

  • Target Groupings: ZSGP, ZSGC
  • Message Class: ZMDGS_MSG_CLASS
  • Message Number: 001
  • Message Type: E
  • Message Text: Tax Number is Mandatory !!!
  • BADI Method Implemented: IF_EX_USMD_RULE_SERVICE~CHECK_ENTITY 

    The validation logic is written directly in the method CHECK_ENTITY

    This ensures that when the specified groupings are selected, the system enforces the presence of a Tax Number and raises a custom message if it's missing.

Code:

 

  METHOD if_ex_usmd_rule_service~check_entity.
    CALL METHOD io_model->read_entity_data_all
      EXPORTING
        i_fieldname    = 'BP_HEADER'            
        if_active      = abap_false            
        i_crequest     = id_crequest            " Change Request
      IMPORTING
        et_data_entity = DATA(lt_data).        " Data for Entity Types
    .
    READ TABLE lt_data INTO DATA(ls_data) WITH KEY usmd_entity = 'BP_HEADER' usmd_entity_cont = ' ' struct = 'KATTR'.
    ASSIGN ls_data-r_t_data->* TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<lt_data>).
    LOOP AT <lt_data> ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_data>).
      ASSIGN COMPONENT 'BU_GROUP' OF STRUCTURE <ls_data> TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<lv_group>).
      IF <lv_group> IS ASSIGNED AND
         <lv_group> EQ 'ZSGP' OR
         <lv_group> EQ 'ZSGC'.
        READ TABLE lt_data INTO ls_data WITH KEY usmd_entity = 'BP_HEADER' usmd_entity_cont = 'BP_TAXNUM' struct = 'KATTR'.
        IF sy-subrc <> 0.
          et_message = VALUE #( ( msgid = 'ZMDGS_MSG_CLASS' msgty = 'E' msgno = '001' ) ).
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDMETHOD.


SAP S/4HANA SAP Master Data Governance ABAP Development 

Thank You, 
Sandeep Suggu.
SAP Community Profile | SAP Profile | LinkedIn

entry.title: Re: PO header and item text do not appear in printed form...
entry.content:
When I said “each text type must be assigned to the output type and language,” I didn’t mean there’s a customizing table where you explicitly list every language. In Purchasing text determination, you only define which text IDs (header, item, etc.) are relevant for output. The language comes from the output message language (NAST-SPRAS) at runtime.

So the checks are in two places:

Path: SPRO → Materials Management → Purchasing → Messages → Texts for Purchase Orders → Define Texts for Purchase Orders. Here you assign which text IDs (e.g. F01 Header Note, F02 Terms, etc.) are pulled into the PO form. This customizing is language‑independent. It just says “include this text ID in the output.”

The actual language handling happens in the form (Smartform/Adobe/SAPscript). At runtime, the system looks for the text in the message language (NAST-SPRAS). If the text exists in that language, it prints. If not, it’s skipped. That’s why EN/FR/DE work (texts exist in those languages), but IT doesn’t.

If you ask me where to check for Italian, go to SE75, and check if your PO text object (e.g. EKKO/EKPO) has Italian maintained. Go to SE63 and check if the text modules used in the Smartform have Italian translations. Go to NAST table and confirm the message really has SPRAS = IT. Go to Smartform and check if the text elements have Italian maintained.

entry.title: Grouping Multiple Dunning Letters into a Single Notice
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

As part of our dunning letter management process, we would like to know if there is a way to group multiple letters into one based on specific criteria (Accountant clerk for instance).

For context, we manage several customer accounts (~1000) that are handled by the same accountant clerk. To improve efficiency for our collections team and maintain a good relationship with clients, we would like to send a single consolidated letter containing the details of all relevant customer accounts.

When reviewing the "Create Dunning Notices" application, it seems that there is currently only one way to enter the list of Business Partners (BPs). With this setup, we believe that the system generates as many separate dunning letters as there are BPs entered, which is not our intended outcome.

Could you please advise ? 

Thank you for your help.
Best regards.

entry.content: If the PO is recorded in Italian (EKKO-SPRAS) and the text exists in Italian (and the form has no conditionals and standard program is used), then you should see the text in Italian display.

entry.title: Intelligent Application - Why is Data stored twice in SAP BDC (Object Store & Ingestion Space)?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

When we install an intelligent Application in SAP Business Data Cloud,
Data products gets data from Object Store into Ingestion layer(Datasphere Space).
So data from S/4HANA is stored twice in SAP Business Data cloud:

  1. 1st its store in Object Store as a File.
  2. 2nd its stored in SAP Datasphere Space via Replication flow taking Object Store as a source.

I wanted to understand what is the advantage of using 2 storages which is causing data duplication?

SAP could have directly stored data from S/4HANA to Datasphere ingestion Space or just share data from Object store to Datasphere space.
Can anyone please explain this strategy/process?

entry.title: Re: OSS User S-USER ID must be shifted to customer number...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

S-Users cannot be moved between customer numbers. Kindly refer to the following KBA for details:

2423500 Can S-user IDs or Technical Communication Users be moved to a different customer number? - SAP for Me

A Super Admin, Cloud Admin or User Admin can create another S-User under the target customer number for the same individual. The following KBA provides step-by-step instructions about S-User creation:

1271482 How does an administrator create or delete S-user IDs? - SAP for Me

Kind regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: Enhanced Variant Table Handling in PMEVC: Excel Download and Upload of Variant Tables
entry.content:
The Product Modeling Environment for Variant Configuration (PMEVC) now supports the download and upload of variant tables, even when they contain multi-value cells. This new capability allows users to copy and work with variant tables more efficiently, enhancing both performance and user experience.

Download Variant Tables with Multi-Value Cells

Previously, downloading variant tables containing multi-value cells to Microsoft Excel was not possible. With the implementation of the SAP Note 3547198, this limitation has been overcome. Here are the highlights of this feature:

  • Multi-Value Cell Handling: Values within multi-value cells are now downloaded with a line break as a separator.
  • File Format: The variant table content is downloaded in the modern .xlsx format, which improves usability and compatibility.
  • Numeric Value Conversion: Numeric values are converted from the user setting format to the internal format for consistent representation.
  • Wildcard Support: Wildcards in variant tables of processing mode Advanced Variant Configuration are downloaded as blank cells.
  • Display Setting: Characteristic values are downloaded based on the display setting in PMEVC, either as values or descriptions. However, characteristics will always be downloaded as value, i.e., using their language-independent name.

How to Download a Variant Table with Multi-value Cells

In the VC Modeling Environment, access the Contents tab of the variant table detail screen and select the dropdown button for export. From the dropdown list select Spreadsheet.

Export

Export -> Spreadsheet

Enter the name of the file to be downloaded and save it.

Resulting Excel file content:

Excel Export with Wildcard (empty cell), Multiple Values per Cell and Interval Value

 

Upload Variant Table Content Directly from Excel

Until now, importing variant table content from Excel required a manual copy and paste process, e.g., CTRL+C and CTRL+V in Windows. With the SAP Note 3562947, users can now directly upload content from a local MS Excel file to a variant table in PMEVC. Key aspects of this feature include:

  • Direct Upload Button: A new button on the PMEVC variant table detail screen allows for direct uploads from the first sheet of an MS Excel file.
  • Error Handling: During the import process, value checks for format and validity are performed, and any incorrect cells are displayed in the message list with exact cell positions.
  • Content Overwrite Option: Users can choose to overwrite existing content or cancel the upload process.

Upload Requirements

To ensure a successful upload, the following conditions must be met:

  1. File Format: The upload file must be in an Office Open XML format (.xlsx, .xlsm, .xls).
  2. Variant Table Status: The variant table status needs to be Released to allow content changes.
  3. Worksheet Content: The first worksheet of the Excel workbook is considered for upload, with the table content starting with technical names of all columns/characteristics in the defined order.
  4. Row and Column Limits: The number of rows to be uploaded is limited to 99,999, and the number of columns to 999.
  5. Value Format: Values in the Excel sheet must be maintained as characteristic values, and specific formatting requirements apply to different cell types.

Formatting Requirements per Cell Type

Characteristic Type of Column

Cell Format in Excel

Format Requirements

Examples

Character

General/Text

No further restrictions than defined for characteristic

string value

Numeric/Currency

General/Text

SAP's internal number format, this means no thousand separator, decimal separator '.'

1234.56789, -423.19112, 123

Number/Currency/Percentage/Accounting/Fraction/Scientific/...

General/Text

No restrictions

 

Date

General/Text

Gregorian date format:
YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY.MM.DD, YYYY/MM/DD, MM/DD/YYYY, DD.MM.YYYY, MM-DD-YYYY

2023-02-18, 2021.07.04, 2020/12/25, 11/25/2022, 05.06.2019, 10-29-2021

Time

General/Text

24 Hour Format: HH:MM:SS

14:23:45, 09:12:01, 23:59:59

Multi-value cells

General/Text (required)

Equivalent to the requirements of the corresponding characteristic value with "General" format. Values must be separated by a line break (Excel shortcut: Alt + Enter to separate values)

aaa
bbb
ccc

Interval

General/Text

Equivalent to the requirements of the corresponding characteristic value with "General" format. The following symbols can be used to construct intervals: Equal '=', hyphen '-', comparison signs '<' and '>', left-open, right-open interval: > a - < b, left-open, right-closed interval: > a - b, left-closed, right-open interval: a - < b, left-closed, right-closed interval: a - b, left-open interval: > a, left-closed interval: >= a, right-open interval: < b, right-closed interval: <= b

 

 

How to Upload a Variant Table with Multi-value Cells

Open the detail screen of a new or existing variant table and access the Contents tab. You can also use the copy function of the working set to create a variant table with the same columns.

Copy a Variant Table

To upload content, you need to change into Edit mode and select the button Upload.

Upload

Select the Excel file from which you want to upload the content. If any content previously existed, you must decide whether you want to overwrite it or cancel the upload process.

Uploaded with Wildcard, Multi-Value Cell, and Interval Value

These enhancements to variant table handling in the PMEVC mark a substantial improvement in usability and efficiency. The ability to download and upload variant tables with multi-value cells, coupled with direct file uploads from Excel, streamlines workflows and reduces manual data handling. By implementing these SAP Notes, users can now enjoy a more seamless and efficient experience when working with variant tables.

For more detailed information, refer to the SAP Note 3547198 for export functionality and to the SAP Note 3562947 for import functionality.

entry.title: What’s New in SAP Build – Q3 2025 Release Highlights
entry.content:
In Q3, we delivered several innovations across AI-powered development, ABAP project creation, modernized SAPUI5 and advanced mobile capabilities. SAP Build also reached a significant milestone with the introduction of MCP servers, allowing developers to boost productivity further with AI agents. 

Check these out in our Top 10 Release Highlights from Q3 2025! 

AI-powered development

1. Empowering developers with MCP Tools for SAP Build 

Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers are now available for the following technologies: SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP), SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori. This is a huge step forward for developers working with popular IDEs and coding assistants like GitHub Copilot, Cursor and more. With these MCP servers, we’re now providing a comprehensive set of tools designed to optimize your development workflow across various SAP technologies.

Learn more in the blog post.

2. SAP HANA Cloud SQL Statement Generation in Joule

Directly in SAP Build Code, the Joule panel now offers the new command /hana-sql-gen, which enables the generation of SQL statements from natural language directly in the panel. The generated statements can be reviewed and refined in the Joule panel. Suitable SQL statements can be either copied to a SQL console or directly executed inside the Joule panel after selecting a database connection on which to run the statement.

3. Expanded AI-powered capabilities in SAP Build Work Zone

SAP Build Work Zone continues to expand its AI capabilities, bringing new built-in features to an intelligent workspace with accelerated decision-making and improved employee experiences:

  • Integration of Joule in SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition: By bringing Joule into SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition, users can now enjoy the power of Joule within their digital workplace. This eliminates the hassle of system-hopping, reduces time wasted on searching for information, and allows employees to focus on what is important. (Note: Available in early October)
  • AI-powered text and comment generation: This enables employees to quickly create, summarize, and engage with workplace content. For example, project managers can generate project status updates in minutes, ensuring their team members stay aligned.

Learn more in the blog post.

Enhanced App Development & Automation

4. Availability of SAPUI5 1.136.x-legacy-free with deprecated code removed 

SAPUI5 1.136.x-legacy-free with deprecated code removed is now available via cloud access. This means app developers can test their UI code for compliance to SAPUI5 best practices. This helps to future-proof an SAP Fiori app for future SAPUI5 versions and work on deprecated/outdated code. Developers can also provide feedback to the UI5 team.

Learn more in the blog post.

5. Create full-stack ABAP projects in SAP Business Application Studio

You can now create full-stack ABAP projects or open an existing ABAP CSN as a project in SAP Business Application Studio. You can also model your application using the CDS Graphical Modeler and generate ABAP development objects. By leveraging high productivity tools, this significantly accelerates time-to-market, improves collaboration and provides a standardized, compliant approach to building extensions.

Learn more in the Help Portal. ..And stay tuned! We’ll share more about this topic at SAP TechEd 2025.

6. Maintenance project for released process automation projects

For process automation, we’ve introduced the ability to create dedicated project versions based on an existing released version. This allows process owners to maintain parallel editable versions while keeping the latest version in place, enabling teams to focus on solving a problem without redoing everything from scratch.

Learn more in the Help Portal.

7. Holistic process views for requestors and participants

Now customers can benefit from dedicated, holistic views across their automated processes. The views provide information about natively running instances across multiple processes and workflows without any external configuration.

8. Outbox functionality for tasks in SAP Task Center

SAP Task Center, which provides a seamless user experience for accessing open tasks, now lets you view completed tasks in an outbox. This provides a complete view of historical data while reducing support requests and efforts around process automation instances.

New innovations for mobile

9. Support for new site experience in SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition 

Employees accessing their workspace content via SAP Mobile Start can now enjoy a new view mode with a more flexible structuring of content. They can quickly view workspace updates, company news or project dashboards, making it easier to organize and consume information in a personalized way. (Note: Available in early October)

 

10. Updates to SAP Mobile Start

As the native mobile entry point to all SAP business apps and content, SAP Mobile Start has released several new innovations that simplify employee tasks and optimize their user experience:

  • SAP Document AI integration: Allows users to upload documents and photos for automated processing. This streamlines document handling, cuts down manual work and ensures data accuracy throughout operations.
  • Enhanced push notifications with more detailed information: Load and display context-specific details directly in the push notification, providing more meaningful and informative messages.
  • Simplified onboarding via deep link: IT teams can invite users to onboard to SAP Mobile Start via an email or message and provide a deep link that the users can use to initiate a simplified onboarding process.
  • Top news on start screen: Shows the most important news in a larger format on top of the Start screen.

Learn more in the latest blog post and Help Portal.

Ready to see these in action?

Join us for the next What’s New in SAP Build Webinar on October 8th as we dive deeper into MCP servers in CAP, SAP Mobile Start innovations, and much more!

Sign up today for your preferred option:
🌐October 8th, 9:00-10:00am CEST (EMEA/APJ friendly): Register here
🌐October 8th, 5:00-6:00pm CEST (Americas friendly): Register here

entry.title: Day 1 EHS & Product Compliance InfoDays
entry.content:
Day 1 began with a great keynote by SAP Chief Sustainability and Commercial Officer Sophia Mendelsohn about how, due to the rapidly evolving business landscape, integrating sustainability with Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) and Product Compliance (PC) is crucial. AI technology offers innovative solutions to enhance this connection, particularly in scaling Scope 3 emissions calculations and transforming supply chain compliance.

Data is the backbone of effective decision-making. By consolidating data from both within SAP systems and outside, businesses can harness a comprehensive view of their operations. This integration acts as a "quantity play," enabling organizations to leverage data for strategic advantage. SAP AI Joule facilitates this by transforming complex data into intuitive visuals, making it easier to understand the impact of carbon reduction initiatives and supply chain adjustments.

 

AI is revolutionizing traditional manual tasks, bringing them into the 21st century. With tools like Joule, businesses can take steps like creating a safer working environment, reducing machine downtime, and saving valuable employee time. This modernization not only enhances operational efficiency but also contributes to a more sustainable and compliant business model.

 

Incorporating AI into your business strategy is not just about keeping up with technological advancements; it's about creating a future where sustainability and efficiency go hand in hand.

Next up was Ralf Coenning discussing the Product Compliance Roadmap and Strategy, and how ensuring product compliance is more crucial than ever. He kicked off with a brief overview of product compliance, breaking it down into key areas: Product Marketability and Component Compliance, Dangerous Goods Management, and Compliance Document Management, which includes safety data sheets and labeling.

The shift towards a highly automated system is a game-changer, embedding regulatory content to keep processes swift and up to date, protecting both your brand and your bottom line. This automation allows businesses to expand their compliance scope, collaborating with partners to access regulatory content beyond the embedded confines. Excitingly, more flexibility is on the horizon, enhancing partner content integration.

 

With the latest functionality on S/4 HANA, product compliance is transitioning from traditional systems to modern, user-friendly solutions. Whether directly within Product Compliance or through partner solutions, these advancements promise a streamlined, efficient approach to managing compliance.

Missed the session? No worries, you can still sign up (see the link below) and get watch on demand or just take a look at the slides used by the presenters. Today, you can join me and many others learning more about Product Compliance and the latest innovations around dangerous goods, product marketability, safety data sheets and labeling. 

https://imsap.co/6048A6bJE

entry.title: Re: Condition Records CDS View in Public Cloud
entry.content: Hi - Please be aware not all views are available/exposed by default in the Customer Data Browser - you need to find them in the View Browser. You can't go by the Customer Data Browser. If you find them in the View Browser and they are "Released" for Key User, then you should be able use them (considering some restrictions and whether or not it is "recommended" for a Custom View) in a Custom CDS View - the Custom CDS View would then be available in the Customer Data Browser.

entry.title: Manage Service Order app is not visible in Public Cloud
entry.content:
We would like to enable the “Manage Service Order” app for a user.

We have already assigned all the required business catalogs and roles to the user as referenced from the SAP Fiori App Library.

However, the app is still not displayed in the user’s launchpad, and when searching in the Fiori Launchpad, it cannot be found.

Why the Manage Service Order app is not visible even after assigning the necessary roles and catalogs?

 

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Manage Service Order app is not visible in Public Cloud
entry.content:
Good day,  

Thank you for raising this issue.   

The behavior you are observing is expected and has been documented in **SAP KBA 2876916**. The “Manage Service Order (F3571A)” app is delivered as a **Smart Business KPI app**. By design, such apps do not appear in the Fiori Launchpad search. 2876916 - Search function - Manage Service Orders app is missing

As a workaround, the app can be found via the **App Finder** and then added to the user’s home page for easier access.  

Hope this clarifies the situation.  

Kind regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: How to Send Custom Headers (e.g., Transaction-Id) in HTTP PATCH Request from SAP CPI
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am working on an integration in SAP Cloud Platform Integration (CPI) where I need to make an HTTP PATCH request and send custom headers such as Transaction-Id, Content-Type, Accept, and Authorization.

I tried to set the headers as a single string like this: Transaction-Id|Content-Type|Accept|Authorization

And also I tried to define in a content modifier and groovy, but it did not work.

Could someone please advise on the correct way to set and send multiple custom headers in a PATCH request from CPI?
Is there a recommended approach using Groovy scripts or Content Modifiers to ensure all headers are included in the outbound HTTP call?

Any examples or best practices would be greatly appreciated!

Note: With POST worked

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Re: CPI Error Message - ChangeSet index 1 - Only one acti...
entry.content: We were getting this error majorly for Contingent Workers who have multiple employment. in CPI it is picking up the non-active User id. We need to change the config in CPI to look at the active employment's User id.
